name: Amy S. Bruckman
content: Amy Bruckman - Home Regents' Professor School of Interactive Computing Georgia Institute of Technology Social Computing, Online Communitites, and Collaborative Computing HOME PAPERS TEACHING CV Location 85 5th St., TSRB 338 Atlanta, GA 30332-0760 Office Hours Email for an appointment Contact asb at cc.gatech.edu Follow Mastodon : asb@hci.social Blog : https://asbruckman.medium.com About Me I am Regents' Professor in the School of Interactive Computing in the College of Computing at Georgia Tech. I received my PhD from the Epistemology and Learning Group at the MIT Media Lab in 1997, and my BA in physics from Harvard University in 1987. I do research on social computing, with interests in collaboration, social movements, content moderation, and internet research ethics. I am an ACM Fellow, and a member of the ACM SIGCHI Academy.
